properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Jimmy Creek, Mafeking, Watgania, Grampians, Moyston
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Grampians, Jimmy Creek, Mafeking, Moyston, Watgania.

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Lynchs Track in a north-easterly direction towards Yarram Gap Road.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads. 
Road Closures:
  •  Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Tourist Road to Moyston-Dunkeld Road.
Grampians National Park visitor information and closures: 
  • Grampians Peaks Trail is closed from Jimmy Creek Road Trail Head to Dunkeld. 
  • Wannon Crossing campground is closed.
  • All walking tracks and campgrounds in the southern area are closed

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 17/12/2024 08:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for Meredith and surrounds.
  • This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued on 19 November 2024.
  • An outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza was detected at Meredith and Lethbridge in May 2024.
  • This warning is relevant for all bird owners including poultry producers, bird keepers and pet bird owners.
  • A control area is in place around Meredith. Bird owners who reside in the control areas no longer need to house all their poultry in cages or sheds.
  • No further cases of avian influenza have been detected in Victoria since 24 June 2024.
Things you should know about avian influenza:
  • Avian influenza is a highly contagious disease that infects chickens, ducks, geese, turkeys, guinea fowl, quail, pheasants and ostriches. Many species of wild birds, including waterfowl and seabirds can also carry the virus.
  • Movement controls remain in place and infected properties have been quarantined. These controls prohibit the movement of birds, equipment and products within and out of the control area until further notice. You can find more information about movement controls and quarantine here: www.agriculture.vic.gov.au/avianflu
  • To stop the spread of avian influenza, infected birds were humanely disposed of.
  • Properly cooked chicken meat and eggs are safe to eat.
  • While cases among humans in direct contact with animals infected with highly pathogenic avian influenza viruses are possible, the current risk to the public remains low.
All bird owners should regularly check their birds. If you suspect your birds are sick you should contact the Emergency Animal Disease Hotline on 1800 675 888.
What you should do:

If you own birds:
  • Do not move your birds, eggs or equipment into, within or out of the control area without a permit.
  • Bird owners should regularly check their birds and immediately report any unusual signs of disease to the Emergency Animal Disease Hotline on 1800 675 888 (free call).
  • Check the Agriculture Victoria website or contact the Customer Service Centre on 136 186 for details on movement controls.
To help prevent the spread of disease to your birds you should:
  • Restrict contact between pet birds, poultry and wild birds.
  • Prevent contamination of food and water by faeces or other animal waste.
  • Keep equipment, yards and aviaries clean.
  • Limit visitors to your birds.
  • Bird owners should wash their hands before and after handling birds.
Check for signs of disease:
Signs of the disease in birds may include:
  • Sudden death.
  • Birds with difficulties breathing, such as coughing, sneezing, or rasping.
  • Swelling and purple discolouration of the head, comb, wattles and neck.
  • Rapid drop in eating, drinking and egg production.
  • Ruffled feathers, dopiness, closed eyes.
  • Diarrhoea.
  • Occasionally, nervous symptoms.
How avian influenza spreads:
  • Avian influenza can be spread to other animals by movement of eggs, birds, people handling birds, vehicles and equipment between farms, and by clothing, footwear, aerosols, water, feed, litter, wild birds, biting insects and vermin.
Protecting your health:
  • You canâ€™t contract avian influenza by eating cooked chicken meat or cooked eggs.
  • Avian influenza does not usually infect people, but in rare cases, human infection can occur.
This message was issued by Agriculture Victoria.

The next update is expected by 17/12/2024 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - ANIMAL DISEASE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Meredith and surrounds Issue Date: Tuesday 03 December 2024, 01:26 pm Next Update: Tuesday 17 December 2024, 05:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/34761/moreinfo This message is being issued for Meredith and surrounds. - This Community Information replaces the Community Information issued on 19 November 2024. - An outbreak of highly pathogenic avian influenza was detected at Meredith and Lethbridge in May 2024. - This warning is relevant for all bird owners including poultry producers, bird keepers and pet bird owners. - A control area is in place around Meredith. Bird owners who reside in the control areas no longer need to house all their poultry in cages or sheds. - No further cases of avian influenza have been detected in Victoria since 24 June 2024. Things you should know about avian influenza: - Avian influenza is a highly contagious disease that infects chickens, ducks, geese, turkeys, guinea fowl, quail, pheasants and ostriches. Many species of wild birds, including waterfowl and seabirds can also carry the virus. - Movement controls remain in place and infected properties have been quarantined. These controls prohibit the movement of birds, equipment and products within and out of the control area until further notice. You can find more information about movement controls and quarantine here: www.agriculture.vic.gov.au/avianflu - To stop the spread of avian influenza, infected birds were humanely disposed of. - Properly cooked chicken meat and eggs are safe to eat. - While cases among humans in direct contact with animals infected with highly pathogenic avian influenza viruses are possible, the current risk to the public remains low. All bird owners should regularly check their birds. If you suspect your birds are sick you should contact the Emergency Animal Disease Hotline on 1800 675 888.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Dean, Newlyn, Springmount, Wattle Flat, Newlyn North
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Dean, Newlyn, Newlyn North, Springmount, Wattle Flat.

  • There is a bushfire at Melbourne Rd, Creswick that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is still active in the Creswick-Dean Road area. 
You should stay informed, monitor conditions and stay away from the area.

To help ensure the safety of our emergency personnel do not fly drones over the fire area. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 

Relief Centre:
The Relief Centre is at Doug Lindsay Reserve, Lindsay Park Drive, Creswick will CLOSE at 11.00am Tuesday 17 December, 2024.

Road Closures:
  • Creswick-Dean Road between Melbourne Road and Ballarat-Daylesford Road.
  • Melbourne Road between Creswick-Dean Road and Howards Road.

Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Djuwang Baring, Creswick Trails is closed Tuesday 17 and Wednesday 18 December 2024

Firefighting vehicles and machinery will be moving around in the area.

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 17/12/2024 04:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

This Advice message is being issued for Barongarook.

  • There is a bushfire at Barongarook- Robinson Road that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling slowly within Otways Forest Park between Robinson Road and Old Beechy Rail trail in a north easterly direction towards Barongarook.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Bulldozers/aircraft are operating in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 17/12/2024 06:20 pm or as the situation changes.

People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:

This will be the final message issued for this fire.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Valencia Creek - Channel Track. 

  • There is a bushfire located in the Avon Mt Hedrick Scenic Reserve that is contained.
  • The bushfire is located in the area of walking tracks near the Channels, north of the Channel Track picnic area.
  • The Channel Loop walking track is closed to the public while firefighters and aircraft continue to attend to this fire.
  • The community is asked to avoid the area and keep the local roads clear.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by FFMVic.

The next update is expected by 19/12/2024 09:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:

  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road.

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Lynchs Track in a north-easterly direction towards Yarram Gap Road. 

Don't wait, leaving now is the safest option - conditions may change and get worse very quickly. Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing.
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.

If the situation changes or you feel unsafe you should leave:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area or a safer location.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely hazardous during a bushfire or high winds. Avoid standing, parking or travelling in areas of fire affected trees.
  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
Road Closures: 
Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Tourist Road to Moyston-Dunkeld Road.

Grampians National Park visitor information and closures: 
  • Grampians Peaks Trail is closed from Jimmy Creek Road Trail Head to Dunkeld.
  • Wannon Crossing campground is closed.
  • All walking tracks and campgrounds in the southern area are closed.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 17/12/2024 07:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Leave Now
Incident Location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road
Issue Date: Tuesday 17 December 2024, 03:14 pm
Next Update: Tuesday 17 December 2024, 07:20 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/34971/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road.

- There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
- The bushfire is travelling from Lynchs Track in a north-easterly direction towards Yarram  Gap Road. 
- 



Don't wait, leaving now is the safest option - conditions may change and get worse very quickly. Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Coonooer West, Dooboobetic .

  • This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued at 5:22 pm Friday 13 December.
  • The haystack fire at Valpine Road, Coonooer West remains contained.
  • Haystack fires are not likely to spread into grassland but do generate a lot of smoke.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby roads and communities as firefighters pull apart the hay to extinguish the fire.
  • This fire may continue to burn for several days.
  • Firefighters will continue to monitor the fire.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this may be the last message issued for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to cal VicEmergency
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Boundary Rd Springhurst.

  • There is a grassfire at Rutherglen-Springhurst Rd, Springhurst that is under control.
  • Firefighters have stopped the spread of the grassfire at Boundary Rd Springhurst.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice Message issued at 3.42pm. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear for emergency services 
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 17/12/2024 06:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bornes Hill, Dunkeld.

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Childs Lane at Brady Swamp that is not yet under control.
  • Fire Crews and Aircraft are responding to the fire. 
You should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services and aircraft are in the area.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Department of Environment, Land, Water & Planning.

The next update is expected by 17/12/2024 05:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

Today, Tue, 17 Dec 2024 has been declared a day of Total Fire Ban in the Mallee and Wimmera district(s) of Victoria.  No fires can be lit or be allowed to remain alight in the open air from 12:01 AM on Tue, 17 Dec 2024 until 11:59 PM Tue, 17 Dec 2024.
